questions.question: What is biology?

choices.answer: The study of living organisms
The study of the planets
A religion
The study of the earth, water, and air

questions.question: What is an observation?

choices.answer: When you make a guess about an outcome
The first step of the scientific method
When you notice something
What happens when you don't participate in class

questions.question: When we make an inference...

choices.answer: we are causing damage to the reputation of science
we are making an explanation based on assumptions
we are testing the hypothesis
we are denying the truth

questions.question: Which one is an example of an inference?

choices.answer: Sally spent $40 at the store, I saw her receipt.
Sally told me she voted "yes" on the proposition
Sally must be tired, she left the party early.
Sally said she had a sandwich for lunch

questions.question: Why do scientists need to be good at asking questions?

choices.answer: To learn useful things
So their investigation is actually helpful
Different kinds of questions give very different answers
They should only ask open-ended questions

questions.question: What is true for open-ended questions?

choices.answer: don't require knowledge of how things work
require a deeper understanding in order to answer
easily answered with 'yes' or 'no'
generally get a short response

questions.question: What is an example of an open-ended question?

choices.answer: How many ounces are in a quart?
How far away is Tijuana?
How do microbes survive in our intestines?
What color is water?

questions.question: What is true for closed-ended questions?

choices.answer: they help us know specific details
people only ask them when they already know the answer
we cannot ask them on multiple-choice exams

questions.question: Which is an example of a closed-ended question?

choices.answer: What do you want to do this weekend?
Will you go to prom with me?
Why does our body support the life of millions of microbes?
How do the microbes in our gut get their nutrients?

questions.question: A hypothesis is...

choices.answer: a testable and falsifiable explanation
what you want to happen at the end of your experiment
how our bodies maintain balance

questions.question: A hypothesis...

choices.answer: is often written to include the methods and outcome
does not need to be testable
does not need to be falsifiable
is only known after you conduct the experiment

questions.question: Which is an example of a hypothesis?

choices.answer: If I do 2 minutes of exercise, then my heart rate will increase.
The cats hate their new cat food

questions.question: What does it mean for something to be 'falsifiable'?

choices.answer: you can pretend it exists even if it doesn't
you can find out whether or not it is correct
there is no evidence that it is correct
there is no evidence that it is incorrect

questions.question: Which of these are falsifiable?

choices.answer: All swans are white
Everyone in this class has four eyes
My kitchen is haunted
God is our savior

questions.question: In science, we are always trying to prove that our hypothesis is correct

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What do we say when the results agree with our hypothesis?

choices.answer: it is proof that my hypothesis is right
winner winner chicken dinner!
my hypothesis has been proven correct
the evidence supports my hypothesis

questions.question: What does the null hypothesis say?

choices.answer: the same as the hypothesis
it is the legal scientific document
there is no relationship between the variables
cats prefer triangular shaped food

questions.question: What is an example of a null hypothesis?

choices.answer: cats show no preference for food based on shape
cats prefer fish shaped cat food
cats will eat worms
cats prefer dog food

questions.question: Sometimes in science, our goal is to disprove the null. Why?

choices.answer: because scientists think there is a relationship between variables
because scientists are dumb
because they might find a relationship that they haven't seen yet
because there is still more to discover

questions.question: What is the independent variable?

choices.answer: the thing we change in an experiment
the response
the group that receives the experiment
the number of experimental subjects

questions.question: Which of these are also true for independent variables?

choices.answer: it is the variable we manipulate
it is the thing that has an effect on the other variable
we put it across the x-axis
it's presence affects the expression of the dependent variable

questions.question: Experiment: I put cockroaches in my moms sock drawer to see how much she freaks out. Which is the independent variable?

choices.answer: sock drawer
freak out
response
cockroaches

questions.question: What is the dependent variable?

choices.answer: the one that responds to the independent variable
the sock drawer

questions.question: Experiment: I put cockroaches in my moms sock drawer to see how much she freaks out. Which is the dependent variable?

choices.answer: sock drawer
freak out
me laughing
cockroaches

questions.question: Why do we have a control group when we run experiments?

choices.answer: to gather as much data as possible
to see how much they respond to the experiment
to see if there is a difference between the groups
because the experimental group gets too much hype

questions.question: What is the difference between the control group and the experimental group?

choices.answer: The experimental group receives the experimental protocol
The control group does not receive the protocol
The control group is the scientists that run the experiment

questions.question: I'm doing an experiment to see if kids run faster after drinking Mountain Dew. What is the control group?

choices.answer: Kids who drank the Dew
Kids who don't drink the Dew
Mountain Dew
Running speed

questions.question: Experiment: Do bacteria living in the intestines of teenagers thrive on Mountain Dew? What's the experimental group?

choices.answer: Bacteria in the intestines
Adults who didn't drink the Dew
Mountain Dew
Teens who drank the Dew

questions.question: I'm doing an experiment to see if eating veggies causes weight gain. What is the independent variable?

choices.answer: Veggies eaten
Weight gain
How much I like veggies
Weight loss

questions.question: What does NOT describe a variable?

choices.answer: They are constant
They can be changed
There can be many to consider, but we try to control them in experiments
They can adapt
